bwwExcerpt: It is funny - sometimes very funny - well crafted, coated with a patina of sparkling sophistication, even at times pointed and almost poignant. It's an enjoyable entertainment. But it does not add up to the significant experience that Allison Janney's character feels. And, while the play touches on such matters as race and class and the struggle for connection in modern life, it does not offer the profound insights that the playwright evidently intends.
